intro: Katherinea interrupta, commonly known as the interrupted katherinea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
